articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Heads of State, Government of Various Countries
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Heads of State, Government of Various Countries
 Cairo, August 9 (KCNA Correspondent) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, separately met Faure Essozimna Gnassingbe, president of Togo, Mahamadou Issoufou, president of Niger, Dmitri Anatoliyevich Medvedev, prime minister of Russia, and Ibrahim Mahlab, prime minister of Egypt, during his visit to Egypt to take part in the opening ceremony of the new Suez Canal.
					 The Togolese president said he is always remembering the most valuable aid and support rendered by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il to Togo, highly praising them for strengthening the non-aligned movement. 
					
					 Rosy is the future of the DPRK led by Marshal Kim Jong Un, he said, expressing his will to make positive efforts for the development of the friendly relations between the two countries.
					
					 The Niger president extended congratulations to Kim Jong Un on his efforts made to develop the Workers' Party of Korea into a powerful party, expressing his will to closely cooperate with the DPRK in international issues and the non-aligned movement.
					
					 The Russian prime minister said that the DPRK is a strong country as it is standing firm against the U.S. moves to isolate and stifle it, sincerely hoping that everything would go well in the DPRK under the guidance of Kim Jong Un.
					
					 The prime minister of Egypt expressed thanks to close Korean friends for taking part in the opening ceremony of the new Suez Canal to congratulate the Egyptian people and share joy with them.
					
					 Highly appreciating the DPRK for always supporting Egypt, the prime minister sincerely wished the Korean people greater progress and development in all fields under the wise guidance of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Greetings to President of Singapore
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Singapore
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, Sunday sent a message of greeting to Tony Tan Keng Yam, president of Singapore, on the occasion of its national day.
					 The message wished  Singapore steady development and prosperity, expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would steadily grow.

articles.title: DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex
articles.content:
DPRK Premier Makes Field Survey of Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Pak Pong Ju made a field survey of the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex.
					 After being briefed on the style design of an underground electric car, he went round the car body, chassis frame, etc. in the process of development and production and learned in detail about its technical performance, mechanical character and other things.
					
					 Then he held a consultative meeting.
					
					 The meeting discussed practical issues of modernizing railways and increasing the role of scientists and technicians in the development of underground electric car.
					
					 Earlier, the premier visited the Nampho Fishery Station and the Nampho Glassware Branch Factory of the Taean Friendship Glass Factory. He stressed the need to take measures for putting fishing on a scientific basis and industrializing the processing of aquatic products and increasing the production of glass bottles for various purposes.

articles.title: DPRK Government Delegation Arrives in Bangkok
articles.content:
DPRK Government Delegation Arrives in Bangkok
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A DPRK government delegation led by Foreign Minister Ri Su Yong arrived in Bangkok Saturday to pay an official visit to Thailand.

articles.title: DPRK Women's Football Team Wins East Asian Cup
articles.content:
DPRK Women's Football Team Wins East Asian Cup
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women's football team won the 2015 East Asia Cup by beating its south Korean rival 2:0.
					 At the match on Saturday Yun Song Mi and Ra Un Sim scored goals at 22nd minutes and 52nd minutes respectively.

articles.title: DPRK Football Team Plays Goalless Match with Its S. Korean Rival
articles.content:
DPRK Football Team Plays Goalless Match with Its S. Korean Rival
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The DPRK soccer team played a match with its south Korean rival on Sunday at the 2015 EAFF East Asia Cup.
					 The match drew 0:0.

articles.title: Red Flag Relay of KPA Service Personnel Goes on in East and West Coastal Areas
articles.content:
Red Flag Relay of KPA Service Personnel Goes on in East and West Coastal Areas
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Service personnel of the Korean People's Army (KPA) participating in the red flag relay are dynamically running in east and west coastal areas.
					 The service personnel running in the east coastal area arrived at Hamhung and Wonsan cities where they laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and paid tribute to them.
					
					 In the course of their journey they held diverse events including a meeting for learning from the spiritual world of the fighters who displayed the self-blasting spirit, singing of revolutionary songs in chorus and sports games.
					
					 They visited the Kamnamu Company on Saturday.
					
					 Going round a monument to the field guidance of the peerlessly great men of Mt. Paektu and a room for the education in the revolutionary history, they were briefed on the fact that Kim Il Sung, Kim Jong Il and Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un visited the company at which they gave important instructions concerning training and combat preparations and improvement of soldiers' living and showed deep loving care for them.
					
					 They watched an art performance given by women soldiers, exchanged their experience in combat and political training and in the efforts to improve their living standard. They also watched swimming training of soldiers of the company.
					
					 They arrived at Height 351, the height of heroes on the forefront in the east on Sunday. They went round various places of the height and held a meeting to pledge revenge and a live bullet firing contest.
					
					 Meanwhile, the service personnel running in the west coastal area visited the Tabaksol Company on Sunday.
					
					 After being briefed in front of the monument to the revolutionary activities of Kim Jong Il, they watched a performance given by the art group of the company.
					
					 The service personnel running in the east and west costal areas are dynamically stepping up their journey towards Panmunjom.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. and S. Korean Regime's Call for "Dismantlement of Nukes"
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Slams U.S. and S. Korean Regime's Call for "Dismantlement of Nukes"
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The U.S. and the south Korean puppet forces are noisily crying out for "the north's dismantlement of its nukes" while describing them as an "obstacle" to peace and stability, says Rodong Sinmun Sunday in an article.
					 It goes on:
					
					 The nuclear issue on the Korean peninsula is a natural product of the U.S. nuclear threat and hostile policy toward the DPRK that have persisted for several decades. 
					
					 But for the U.S. shipment of  nuclear weapons to south Korea, the nuclear issue would not have surfaced on the peninsula.
					
					 The nuclear threat can be defused only with nuclear deterrent. This is the final conclusion drawn by the DPRK.
					
					 It was compelled to have access to nuclear deterrent to foil the U.S. and puppet forces' adventurous nuclear war moves and protect the security of the nation and peace on the peninsula.
					
					 The puppet forces have no face to talk about someone's "dismantlement of nukes" as they allowed U.S. shipment of nuclear weapons to south Korea, hell-bent on the moves for a war against the north and have zealously pulled outsiders' chariot of a nuclear war against the north.
					
					 The U.S. and the puppet forces' persistent nuclear war threat against the north and their policy of confrontation with it were the root cause that spawned the nuclear issue on the peninsula.
					
					 The peace and security on the peninsula are guaranteed by the DPRK's line of simultaneously developing the two fronts, the line calling for bolstering up its nuclear deterrent for self-defense in every way.
					
					 This nuclear deterrent can never be a political bargaining chip.

articles.title: S. Korean Buddhist Organizations Demand Authorities' Lifting of Measure for Confrontation
articles.content:
S. Korean Buddhist Organizations Demand Authorities' Lifting of Measure for Confrontation
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The south Korean joint conference of Buddhist organizations for preparing for events marking 70th anniversary of August 15  liberation on August 6 demanded the puppet regime lift the "May 24 measure" and opt for mending the inter-Korean relations, according to the south Korean Yonhap News.
					 The organization held that the measure is an actual and institutional hurdle lying in the way of dialogue, exchange and cooperation between the south and the north.
					
					 It demanded the "government" take practical measures for improving the inter-Korean relations such as lifting the said measure.

articles.title: Japanese Government Urged to Redress Its Past Crimes
articles.content:
Japanese Government Urged to Redress Its Past Crimes 
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Koreans in Akida Prefecture, Japan and Japanese citizens demanded the Japanese government redress its past crimes while disclosing those crimes committed by the Japanese imperialists. 
					 A memorial service was held in Yokode City on June 20 for the Korean victims who were forcibly drafted by the Japanese imperialists to do slave labor at the Yoshino Mine.
					
					 Kim Hyo Min, chairman of the Akida Prefectural Headquarters of the General Association of Korean Residents in Japan, in a memorial address said that the remains of the Koreans who died a grievous death after forcible drafting are buried until today greeting the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, adding that the Japanese government is wholly to blame for this.
					
					 A memorial service for Korean victims took place in Yamamoto County on July 11.
					
					 The representative of the Akida Prefectural Fact-Finding Group for Probing the Truth about the Forcible Drafting of Koreans said that the group conducted brisk survey which resulted in confirming the fact that more than 14,300 Koreans were forcibly drafted in 79 places of the prefecture.
					
					 The representative said that the group would steadily push forward its survey and invite notably young people to take active part in the activities and urge the Japanese government to opt to redress its past crimes.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech Introduced in Turkey
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Speech Introduced in Turkey
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The gist of the congratulatory speech made by supreme leader Kim Jong Un at the 4th National Conference of War Veterans was carried by the Turkish paper Sabah on August 2.
					 The congratulatory speech, made on July 25, Juche 104 (2015), clarifies that July 27 of Korea is the second Day of Liberation when the Korean people defended with honor their country's dignity and sovereignty from the brigandish aggression by the U.S. imperialists, and also the day of proud victors that put the U.S. imperialists on a downhill march towards ruin.
					
					 It also says: The war veterans have devoted all their life to the independent reunification and prosperity of their country. Their noble fighting spirit and splendid patriotic feats will shine brilliantly in inerasable golden letters in the history of the heroic struggle of our people.

articles.title: V-Day of DPRK Observed by Foreign Bodies
articles.content:
V-Day of DPRK Observed by Foreign Bodies
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- Foreign bodies featured articles on their websites to mark the 62nd anniversary of the Korean people's victory in the great Fatherland Liberation War.
					 The Anti-Imperialist Forum of Germany posted a special write-up titled "DPRK won victory thanks to iron-willed brilliant commander" illustrated with 16 photos of President Kim Il Sung.
					
					 It also posted 20 odd photos showing matchless self-sacrificing spirit and popular heroism of the service personnel and people of the DPRK and ignominious defeat of the U.S. imperialists in the period of the Fatherland Liberation War and articles titled "Invincible strength, fruition of  profound love", "Military wisdom that brought about war victory" and "Strength of Korea."
					
					 Noting the Korean people's victory in the war was a brilliant fruition of the gifted generalship, strategies and tactics and deep love of the President, the website said the stories about his profound love related in the flames of the war are conveyed like legends to explain what was the source of the indestructible strength which enabled the service personnel and people of the DPRK to display matchless courage and win a victory in the war. 
					
					 The Society for the Promotion of the Relations between Austria and the DPRK posted an article titled "Everlasting history of war victory" illustrated with a photo of the President and the Anti-Imperialist Front of France an article titled "Banner of victory."

articles.title: DPRK Praised by Guinean Body
articles.content:
DPRK Praised by Guinean Body
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- The Guinean preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and Korea's Liberation released a bulletin on July 28.
					 The bulletin in an article titled "Korea's liberation, turning point in history" said August 15, 1945 was the day of a historical turning point for the Korean people.
					
					 As the country was liberated, the Korean people could lead an independent and dignified life as masters of their destiny and full-fledged masters of the state and society free from the colonial slavery of the Japanese imperialists, the article said, and went on:
					
					 The DPRK, the first people's democratic state in the East, was founded at last.
					
					 A unique socialist system centered on the popular masses, an invincible socialist state, was established in Korea.
					
					 The DPRK is admired by the world community as it has firmly upheld its ideology, social system and cause without making any slightest deviation from the road of socialism, its own choice.

articles.title: Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in India, Ethiopia
articles.content:
Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Observed in India, Ethiopia
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A seminar, book exhibition and film show were held by the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India and round-table talks at an Ethiopian hospital on Aug. 3 to observe the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 On display at the book exhibition were Korean books dealing with the undying exploits of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il and introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Participants of the film show watched the Korean film "My Country Has Emerged Victorious by Dint of Single-minded Unity".
					
					 The chairman of the Juche Philosophy Study Committee of India said that the Japanese imperialists worked hard to stamp out the time-honored history of the Korean nation, blustering that Koreans should either obey the Japanese law or die, and tried to deprive them of even their mother tongue and names.
					
					 At that time, the President started his revolutionary struggle in his teens, founded the Korean People's Revolutionary Army, defeated the Japanese imperialists, who dreamed of dominating the world, with his unique strategy and superb guerilla warfare and thus liberated the country, the chairman added.

articles.title: DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Denmark
articles.content:
DPRK's Important Days to Be Marked in Denmark
 Pyongyang, August 9 (KCNA) -- A Danish preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea was formed in Copenhagen on Tuesday.
					 H. Jacobsen, member of the leadership of the Communist Party in Denmark, and Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, were elected co-chairmen of the preparatory committee.
					
					 The committee decided to hold diverse political and cultural events including meeting and photo exhibition on these anniversaries.
